result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L. Crutcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or cimrinal charge made against the deft.

superMiscConds.notes:
Extended Supervision conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.
Court obligations still due and owing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew L. Crutcher

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Sentence arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 1yr & 1yr of WSP concurrent to 09CF580.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Credit for 215 days.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Defense counsel did not receive the revocation summary or revocation order/warrant.  SEHR adj to 4/13/17 @ 3pm.
SEHR will be rescheduled;  Attorney McGrath is out sick today, no objection from DA
SEHR adj to 4/11/17 @ 10:30am in order for Atty Hertz-McGrath to be present on behalf of deft

Revoc packet received; copy forwarded to DA's office & PD's office via email
from Agent Casandra Jones - re: new charges for deft; DOC pursuing revocation
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Detective Den Hartog present; provided a statement of the events on the day of the offense re: the money which was seized, but has since been returned to deft.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.
email received from deft's Illinois agent re: travel permit
to Cancel Warrant
warrant cancelled w/Aurora in Records @ 10:42am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Laura Walker.  Atty Walker has now been retained by the deft.  Atty Hilary Edwards is allowed to withdraw.  Warrant vacated; bond re-instated.  Bond forfeiture is vacated.  Sentencing hrg set for 6/9/16 @ 2pm.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Hilary Edwards appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Deft left voice mail message yesterday for court clerk stating he could not make it to court today since he had no ride.  Email received from defense counsel this morning which states the deft had no ride and did not have a travel permit to come here from Illinois; deft under supervision in Wisconsin & Illinois.  Court authorizes bench warrant; $2500 cash bond.  Prior bond ordered forfeited.
Email from State Public Defender
copy of letter sent from DA's office to defense counsel re: discovery attached

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Defense counsel raising objections to certain statements contained in the report.  Brief discussion held.  Court wants add'l information on where the deft obtained the $5200.  Attys may bring in witnesses to the next hrg.  Sentencing/MH set for 3/31/16 @ 11am.
from Agent Erin Angel - deft's adjustment to his probation sentence
Email sent to P&P agent Erin Angel requesting a memo on deft's progress on probation

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Hilary Edwards.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing set over to 2/18/16 @ 10:45am.  Court would like an update/memo from P&P on deft's progress.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
